data.title: Tour of downtown JAX
data.text: Delious lunches for all four of us! Easy in and out when exploring downtown. My chicken salad was was sumptuous as well as delicious. Other meals wer plentiful and reasonably priced.

data.title: Great Lunch Spot for Business or Leisure
data.text:
Nola Moca is a great choice if you're downtown on business or pleasure.  A local colleague of mine introduced me to Moca on a recent trip and I took another out of town colleague on my subsequent trip.

Very airy, nice but not overly elegant dining area with a view of the downtown Hemming Park.  The menu is really outstanding with many creative choices and daily specials.  I enjoyed 2 different wraps, one vegetarian and one fried chicken, and both were excellent.  The flavored butter of the day served with the rolls is very good.  The salads are also creative and very good.

On neither trip did we have to wait long for a table mid-day.  Service was prompt and professional.

Prices are reasonable, particularly if you compare it to what you'd pay in DC or Chicago for similar ambiance and food quality.

data.title: Chi chi, elegant, all the good stuff...
data.text: This restaurant is a gem. Located in the Museum of Contemporary Art on Laura Street, it is a little jewel in downtown Jacksonville. The menu is lovely. It is busy but not noisy. Service is cool and professional - NOT the "Hi I'm so-and-so and I'll be your server. I've been working her for umpteen years and I love pets and my blood type is whatever." A real oasis.

data.title: Eat here and support MOCA Jacksonville
data.text: This restaurant is located inside of MOCA Jacksonville Downtown.  They serve high quality, fresh made dishes with an open kitchen.  This is mostly a lunch spot as they are only open for dinner on Thursday nights and the first Wednesday of each month for Downtown Art Walk. We waited at the door to be seated and took a little bit before we got acknowledged to be seated, but they are not busy or big enough to have a hostess.  Once we were seated we were greeted promptly by our server and she took our drink orders.  She paid us great attention and was always checking on us. We got some appetizers to share and had the daily flatbread, fried macaroni and cheese balls, and the sweet potato nachos that were all really good!!  I never would of ordered the sweet potato nachos (house fried sweet potatoes, blue cheese, applewood-smoked bacon, scallions, with balsamic reduction), but was so glad we did as it was by far my favorite appetizer we had.  I love shrimp and grits and ordered them here and they were really good and loved the grit cakes however for the price there should of been more than 5 small shrimps.  I also tried the Asian Noodle Bowl and added roasted chicken to it and it was fabulous! The roasted chicken was so tender that you did not even need a knife to cut it.  This bowl comes cold with lettuce, spicy vegetable noodle salad, cucumber, peanuts, cilantro, sesame seeds, chili-citrus vinaigrette and has so many great favors with every bite.  It was a nice light and refreshing entree.  Each time you eat here you are supporting the work of MOCA Jacksonville, a nonprofit.

data.title: New York in Jax
data.text: The highlight of any trip to Hemming Plaza has to be lunch at Cafe Nola. Sandwiched between (no pun!) the Museum of Contemporary Art and the Main Library, Cafe Nola is one of the shining stars of Downtown.  The seasonal, often monthly menu, is always a delight, and the offerings have something for every palate and diet.  Modern, sleek, as elegant as anyone could wish, Cafe Nola is the sort of restaurant perfect for impressing business prospects, out-of-town guests, and treating oneself to a truly delightful meal.

data.title: Great treat while visiting MOCA
data.text: What a pleasant surprise is tucked in the foyer of MOCA!  Excellent menu, many daily specials.  Black bean burger + homemade sweet potato chips:  super!  Pasta:  excellent and generous portion.  Service was attentive and prompt.  I want to try the grilled cheese, onion soup, shrimp'n'grits, and many other items on the menu.  We stopped in after reviewing menus of other downtown restaurants and we are glad we came to Cafe NOLA.  The Smoke and Mirrors exhibit at MOCA is also fun.  Great job NOLA; we will be back!

data.title: A Great Delight Tucked Away In A Museum
data.text:
This is by far one of the best restaurants in Jacksonville.  It's a "sleeper" location because it's tucked away in the MOCA.  

However, those of us that are familiar with its great menu and service, wish to keep it a secret.  Otherwise, we will have a hard time getting a table.  Shhhh.

Everything is made to order, the soups are amazing, and the salads are fantastic.

data.title: Good grilled cheese sandwich
data.text: Good food - upscale bistro type menu.  I had a half grilled cheese and salad.  The grilled cheese was made with havarti dill.  Very unusual and very tasty.  Salad was fresh, organic greens, not overdressed.

data.title: Noodle Salad to Die For!
data.text: This is a lovely café tucked inside MOCA (Museum of Contemporary Art) in downtown Jacksonville.  My companion and I both had salads - hers was roasted beets and fingerling potatoes on a bed of kale with beet frizzles.  Mine was a fantastic Japanese noodle salad with shrimp that had a bed of spring greens and a balsamic dressing. The restaurant is very light and airy - something that feels very good in the Jacksonville summer.  One caution - the hours are short - 11-2 for lunch Monday through Friday.  They are open for dinner on Thursday evenings when the museum is open and for the 1st Wednesday Art Walk.  Plan carefully, get there, and you'll be amply rewarded.

data.title: Catch of Day: Tile fish
data.text: I had the blackened catch of the day. It was my 1st time having tile fish. The fish was on top if a creamy corn and surrounded by crispy collards. The dish was well crafted and the taste combination was spot on.

data.title: Wonderful downtown dining
data.text: A fabulous spot tucked inside MOCA Jacksonville. The ambiance is clean, light, and open--as you might expect of a contemporary art museum. The menu is fresh and eclectic but trends toward southern-style dishes, ie. the sweet potato nachos. For my main, I usually order the black bean burger or the beet salad.

data.title: upscale expensive
data.text: nice place, nice food, nice service. Those that eat there are probobly expensing it off an account or our taxes. All suits and ties. Don't get me wrong food is good and so is the service it's just way more expensive than it should be. Lunch is 14-20 per person without tea or a drink. Nice but I'll try the rest of town before going back. Kind of wierd with so many homeless folks just outside the front door in the park.

data.title: Contemporary dining surprise
data.text: Sitting adjacent to Hemming Park and inside the Museum of Contemporary Art is the dining surprise in downtown Jacksonville.  The menu is so interesting and varied, I had a difficult time determining my lunch order.  Based on the waiter's recommendation, I tried the Shrimp & Grits.  It was the best Shrimp & Grits, I have ever had.   The grits are a grit cake which a lovely consistently compared to the traditional grits.  But it was the sherry/applewood bacon sauce that captured me.  The crowd is a traditional downtown business group, the wait staff is good not overwhelming and prices are reasonable.

data.title: Better than average
data.text:
We actually tried the Mother's Day brunch today. The atmosphere was eclectic and the food was fresh and flavorful. Even the kids food was well thoughtful. 
However, parking was kind of a nightmare and I thought the price point was too high. We also visited MOCA, which is easy when dining here.

data.title: Small portions high prices
data.text: Ordered the $16 grouper salad for lunch, I'm thinking it was maybe 2 ounces of fish, maybe 3 fork fulls worth. The bread that came out first was the best part of the meal, nice homemade flavored butter, good atmosphere you can watch the goers by downtown, but I will not be going back. For this price could have gone to many of other places for a better end result.

data.title: Was it worth it?
data.text: Hmm, what are the positives. Ambience was nice, it was in the museum.  Food, was ok, it needed a little seasoning, but good. Service with a smile, didn't get it. Our waiter "j" was a lacking a little.  He appeared to be a little preoccupied.  But overall it was ok, would I come again; no. But you may enjoy it.

data.title: Upscale and Eclectic Menu
data.text: A little cafe in the Jacksonville Museum of Contemporary Art.  Somewhat upscale, eclectic menu with lunch entrees averaging $10 - $12.  Portions are ample, almost big enough to share.  Good selection of salads, wraps, and other luncheon fare.  You wouldn't want to eat there every day but it's convenient if you are visiting the museum.

data.title: Great Food and Location
data.text: There didn't seem much to choose from in the downtown area. As my wife and I walked to the Museum of Contemporary Art we saw that it had a Cafe. Our experiences with cafes in European Museums have all been positive so we decided to give it a try. The food selection was good and intriguing, but more important, it was delicious so we returned the next day. Our only regret was that it was closed that night due to a special function. The museum is also worth the visiti.

data.title: Great -even for a large group
data.text: We went in a large group - approximately 20 (and another large party arrived at the same time).  The staff was very quick for our order.  Food was a bit slow to arrive but what can you expect when they are hit with that many at once.  The dinner rolls were tasty---I think it was banana butter!  There are a wide variety of entrees - seafood, sandwiches.  Best of all, even with a large group they willingly gave us all separate checks.

data.title: Great place, right in the museum
data.text: I had a very good meal with a group of about 20 fellow conference attendees.  The service and food were above what one might expect from a museum restaurant.  Pleasant, bright, with modern food and well-sourced ingredients.
